name: Clin N GIST Rectum
title: Clinical N
notes:
**Note 1:**  Code only regional nodes and nodes, NOS, in this field.  Distant nodes are coded in M (distant metastasis).

**Note 2:**   Regional lymph node involvement is rare for GISTs, so that cases in which the nodal status is not associated clinically are classified as cN0 instead of cNX.

**Regional lymph nodes for rectosigmoid junction and rectum**
    
**All sites:** 

    Hemorrhoidal (middle, superior) 
    Inferior mesenteric 
    Mesenteric [NOS] 
    Perirectal 
    Rectal (middle) 
    Rectal [NOS] 
    Rectal (superior) 
    Rectosigmoid (paracolic/pericolic)
    Sigmoidal (sigmoid mesenteric)

**Rectosigmoid (C199)** 

    Colic, (NOS) 
    Left colic
  
**Rectum (C209)** 

    Hemorrhoidal (inferior) 
    Internal iliac (hypogastric)  
    Lateral (laterosacral) 
    Middle (promontorial) (Gerota's node) 
    Obturator
    Presacral
    Rectal (inferior) 
    Sacral (NOS)
    Sacral promontory
rows: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

Clinical evaluation but unknown results or regional lymph node involvement not stated
Clinical evaluation done but results not documented in patient record

Nodule(s) or foci in perirectal fat

Regional lymph nodes, NOS
Lymph nodes, NOS

Stated as N1
In situ case but no pTis is defined by TNM

No clinical evaluation of regional lymph nodes
Cancer first detected on surgical resection
Unknown if any clinical assessment performed
